articles.title: World Cup hero? Even triumph for Messi will not save this compromised spectacle
articles.description: Lionel Messi leading Argentina to glory would be a moment of sporting beauty but still a sportswashing win for Qatar
articles.content: Buenos Aires has a new Diego Maradona mural for the World Cup. It looks great, although the vast, Stalinist-scale Diego head selected by the artist is not the obvious version from 1986, when the quality of the light, the white noise in the stadiums a... [7105 chars]

articles.title: Argentina ace Lionel Messi selected for fifth World Cup as part of lethal attack alongside Paulo Dybala, Lautaro Martinez and Julian Alvarez with five Premier League players named in 26-man squad
articles.description: Lionel Messi will form a lethal attack alongside Paulo Dybala, Lautaro Martinez and Julian Alvarez after being named in his fifth Argentina World Cup
articles.content:
Lionel Messi will form a lethal attack alongside Paulo Dybala, Lautaro Martinez and Julian Alvarez after being named in his fifth Argentina World Cup squad.

articles.title: Soccer-Saudi Arabia World Cup squad
articles.description:
Saudi Arabia coach Herve Renard named his 26-man squad for the Nov. 20-Dec. 18 World Cup on Friday.
Saudi Arabia are in Group C alongside Argentina, Mexico and Poland.
articles.content:
Saudi Arabia coach Herve Renard named his 26-man squad for the Nov. 20-Dec. 18 World Cup on Friday. Saudi Arabia are in Group C alongside Argentina, Mexico and Poland. Squad:

articles.title: Lionel Messi Leads Star-studded Argentina's FIFA World Cup Squad
articles.description: Lionel Scaloni named a star-studded Argentina squad, led by Lionel Messi, for the Qatar 2022 FIFA World Cup
articles.content:
Injured forward Paulo Dybala made the cut as Argentina coach Lionel Scaloni named on Friday his 26-man squad for the Nov. 20-Dec. 18 World Cup in Qatar.
Captain Lionel Messi will lead the squad in Qatar at his fifth and probably last World Cup.

articles.title: Lionel Messi, Angel Di Maria spearhead Argentina's FIFA World Cup squad
articles.description: Lionel Messi will lead 26-man Argentina squad in what is expected to be his last FIFA World Cup
articles.content:
Buenos Aires: Paulo Dybala and Angel Di Maria were included in coach Lionel Scaloni’s 26-man Argentina World Cup squad on Friday after recovering from injuries but there was no place for Giovani Lo Celso.

articles.title: Argentina, Poland, Mexico, Saudi Arabia
articles.description: Lionel Messi and Robert Lewandowski will be centre of attraction in Group C as Argentina and Poland are among favourites to qualify to knockout stages of FIFA World Cup
articles.content:
Paris: Lionel Messi knows he has one last shot at winning the World Cup with Argentina, who will arrive in Qatar unbeaten in 35 matches after an impressive qualifying campaign and last year’s Copa America triumph in Brazil.
